intro: Sobralia paludosa, commonly known as the swamp sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in marshy or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are usually broad and lance-shaped, and it produces fragrant, colorful flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Sobralia paludosa is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
